entry.title: Relax OP_RETURN standardness restrictions
entry.summary: The discussion revolves around the technical aspects of data storage on the blockchain, specifically focusing on the efficiency and implications of utilizing OP_RETURN compared to storing data in the witness section. The analysis suggests that opting for OP_RETURN for data storage purposes would result in significantly higher expenditure and lower data storage efficiency, as it would deplete funds four times faster while storing four times less data. This observation leads to speculation about the strategic removal of OP_RETURN constraints in policy, proposing that such a move could potentially serve as a countermeasure against spamming activities on the blockchain. This insight reflects a nuanced understanding of blockchain technology's operational parameters and highlights strategic considerations in its governance and technical evolution.
